hints.content:
Sequence $x$: Add $\green5$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blue{10}\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blue{10}+\green5=\pink{15}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\pink{15}+\green5=\purple{20}\end{align}$

Sequence $y$: Add $\gray1$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blue2\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blue2+\gray1=\pink{3}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\pink{3}+\gray1=\purple{4}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\blue{10}\times\green{\dfrac{1}{5}}&=\blue2\\
\\
\pink{15}\times\green{\dfrac{1}{5}}&=\pink{3}\\
\\
\purple{20}\times\green{\dfrac{1}{5}}&=\purple{4}\end{align}$

So the terms in sequence $y$ are $\green{\dfrac{1}{5}}$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

Our table of values should look like this:

$x$ | $y$ 
- | - | -
$10$ | $2$ 
$15$ | $3$ 
$20$ | $4$

The terms in sequence $y$ are $\dfrac{1}{5}$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

hints.content:
Sequence $x$: Add $\green4$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blueD8\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blueD8+\greenD4=\maroonD{12}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\maroonD{12}+\greenD4=\purpleD{16}\end{align}$

Sequence $y$: Add $\goldD2$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blueD4\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blueD4+\goldD2=\maroonD{6}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\maroonD{6}+\goldD2=\purpleD{8}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\blueD8\times{}\green{?}&=\blueD4\\
\\
\maroonD{12}\times{}\green{?}&=\maroonD{6}\\
\\
\purpleD{16}\times{}\green{?}&=\purpleD{8}\end{align}$

Each $x$ term can be multiplied by $\greenD{\dfrac12}$ to result in each $y$ term.

Our table of values should look like this:

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$8$ | $4$ 
$12$ | $6$ 
$16$ | $8$

The terms in sequence $y$ are $\green{\dfrac{1}{2}}$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

question.content:
A table is made using the following two patterns.

Pattern $x$: Starting number: $5$, Rule: add $1$

Pattern $y$: Starting number: $10$, Rule: add $2$

**Complete the table for the given patterns.** 

  

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$5$ | $10$
 [[☃ numeric-input 1]]| [[☃ numeric-input 2]]
 [[☃ numeric-input 3]] |  [[☃ numeric-input 4]]


**The terms in pattern $y$ are [[☃ dropdown 1]] times the terms in pattern $x$.**

hints.content:
Sequence $x$: Add $\greenD6$

$\qquad\begin{align}
\text{Starting term}&: \blueD{10}\\\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blueD{10}+\greenD6=\maroonD{16}\\\\
\text{Term 3}&:\maroonD{16}+\greenD6=\purpleD{22}\end{align}$

Sequence $y$: Add $\goldD6$

$\qquad\begin{align}
\text{Starting term}&: \blueD2\\\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blueD2+\goldD6=\maroonD{8}\\\\
\text{Term 3}&:\maroonD{8}+\goldD6=\purpleD{14}\end{align}$

Now, let's find the difference between the $x$ and $y$ values.

$x$ | $y$ | Difference
:-: | :-: | :-:
$10$ | $2$ |$10\greenD{-8}=2$
$16$ |$8$ | $16\greenD{-8}=8$
$22$ | $14$ | $22\greenD{-8}=14$



The terms in sequence $y$ are $\greenD{8}$ less than the terms in sequence $x$.

Our table of values should look like this:

$x$ | $y$ 
:-: | :-: 
$10$ | $2$ 
$16$ | $8$ 
$22$ | $14$


The terms in sequence $y$ are $8$ less than the terms in sequence $x$.
